001/**
002 * This controller Initializes a default data range as the last 7 days and populates a table with the item names and its corresponding sales totals .
003 * @author Aashikha Basappa
004 */
005package src.controller;
006
007import java.net.URL;
008import java.sql.Connection;
009import java.sql.PreparedStatement;
010import java.sql.ResultSet;
011import java.time.LocalDate;
012import java.util.ResourceBundle;
013
014import javafx.beans.property.SimpleStringProperty;
015import javafx.collections.FXCollections;
016import javafx.event.ActionEvent;
017import javafx.fxml.FXML;
018import javafx.fxml.Initializable;
019import javafx.scene.control.Alert;
020import javafx.scene.control.DatePicker;
021import javafx.scene.control.TableColumn;
022import javafx.scene.control.TableView;
023import javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent;
024import static src.controller.useful_functions.switch_scene;
025import src.database.db_connect;
026
027/**
028 * Controller for the Sales page 
029 *      - Initializes a default data range as the last 7 days 
030 *      - Takes in user-selected dates 
031 *      - Queries the database for sales totals for each item within the user provided or default range 
032 *      - Populates a table with the item names and its corresponding sales totals 
033 */
034public class sales_page_controller implements Initializable {
035    // Allows user to specifiy the date range for the data
036    @FXML private DatePicker startDatePicker;
037    @FXML private DatePicker endDatePicker;
038
039    // creates the Sales Table and the columns in it
040    @FXML private TableView<ItemRow> sales_table;
041    @FXML private TableColumn<ItemRow, String> col_item;
042    @FXML private TableColumn<ItemRow, String> col_sales;
043
044    /**
045     * Navigate back to the manager main page.
046    */
047    @FXML private void handle_back_click(ActionEvent event) { switch_scene("GUI/manager_view.fxml", event); }
048    /**
049     * Navigate to the X report page.
050    */
051    @FXML private void handle_x_report_click(ActionEvent event) { switch_scene("GUI/x_report.fxml", event); }
052    /**
053     * Navigate to the Z report page.
054    */
055    @FXML private void handle_z_report_click(ActionEvent event) { switch_scene("GUI/z_report.fxml", event); }
056    /**
057     * Navigate to the menu page.
058    */   
059    @FXML private void handle_menu_click(MouseEvent event) { switch_scene("GUI/menu_items_page.fxml", event); }
060    /**
061     * Navigate to the inventory page.
062    */       
063    @FXML private void handle_inventory_click(MouseEvent event) { switch_scene("GUI/inventory_page.fxml", event); }
064    /**
065     * Reload the sales page
066    */  
067    @FXML private void handle_sales_click(MouseEvent event) { switch_scene("GUI/sales_page.fxml", event); }
068
069    /**
070     * Establish model for rows of sales table.
071     */
072    public static class ItemRow {
073        private final SimpleStringProperty item;
074        private final SimpleStringProperty sales; 
075        // add formatting for table contents 
076        /**
077         * Create a row in the table for an item. 
078         * @param item - product name 
079         * @param sales - product sales total 
080         */
081        public ItemRow(String item, double sales) {
082            this.item  = new SimpleStringProperty(item);
083            this.sales = new SimpleStringProperty(String.format("$%.2f", sales));
084        }
085        /** 
086         * Retrieves product name 
087         * @return product name 
088         * */
089        public String getItem()  { return item.get(); }
090        /** 
091         * Retrieves the currency-formated sales total
092         * @return currency-formatted sales total 
093         * */
094        public String getSales() { return sales.get(); }
095    }
096
097    //  Initialization
098    /**
099     * Initializes the sales page controller to have default data range and initial load
100     */
101    @Override
102    public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle rb) {
103        // Default the date range to the last 7 days
104        LocalDate today = LocalDate.now();
105        startDatePicker.setValue(today.minusDays(6));
106        endDatePicker.setValue(today);
107
108        // Bind columns to ItemRow getters
109        col_item.setCellValueFactory(cd -> new SimpleStringProperty(cd.getValue().getItem()));
110        col_sales.setCellValueFactory(cd -> new SimpleStringProperty(cd.getValue().getSales()));
111
112        // Right-align the column
113        col_sales.setStyle("-fx-alignment: CENTER-RIGHT;");
114
115        // Initial load
116        refreshSalesTable(startDatePicker.getValue(), endDatePicker.getValue());
117    }
118
119    //  Run button handler
120    /**
121     * Run button handler 
122     * Checks that the data range is valid and reloads the sales table based on the date. Shows an error message if the there is a problem with a data range. 
123     */
124    @FXML
125    private void handle_run_item_report(ActionEvent event) {
126        LocalDate start = startDatePicker.getValue();
127        LocalDate end   = endDatePicker.getValue();
128
129        if (start == null || end == null) {
130            showAlert("Please select both start and end dates.");
131            return;
132        }
133        if (end.isBefore(start)) {
134            showAlert("End date cannot be before start date.");
135            return;
136        }
137
138        refreshSalesTable(start, end);
139    }
140
141    //  DB load using query
142    /**
143     * Query the database with sales totals for each item within the designated data range and populate the table. 
144     */
145    private void refreshSalesTable(LocalDate start, LocalDate end) {
146
147        final String sql = """
148            WITH orders_in_window AS (
149              SELECT orderid
150              FROM orders
151              WHERE orderdate BETWEEN ? AND ?
152            )
153            SELECT
154              p.productname AS item_name,
155              COUNT(*)      AS units_sold,     -- each orderitems row = 1 unit
156              COUNT(DISTINCT oiw.orderid) AS orders_count,
157              SUM(p.price)  AS total_sales     -- price per line (qty=1)
158            FROM orders_in_window oiw
159            JOIN orderitems oi ON oi.orderid = oiw.orderid
160            JOIN products   p  ON p.productid = oi.productid
161            GROUP BY p.productname
162            ORDER BY total_sales DESC, item_name ASC;
163        """;
164
165        var rows = FXCollections.<ItemRow>observableArrayList();
166
167        try (Connection conn = db_connect.getConnection();
168             PreparedStatement ps = conn.prepareStatement(sql)) {
169
170            ps.setDate(1, java.sql.Date.valueOf(start));
171            ps.setDate(2, java.sql.Date.valueOf(end));
172
173            try (ResultSet rs = ps.executeQuery()) {
174                while (rs.next()) {
175                    String itemName   = rs.getString("item_name");
176                    double totalSales = rs.getDouble("total_sales");
177                    rows.add(new ItemRow(itemName, totalSales));
178                }
179            }
180        } catch (Exception e) {
181            System.err.println("Sales report error: " + e.getClass().getSimpleName() + " â€” " + e.getMessage());
182            showAlert("Error loading sales report: " + e.getMessage());
183        }
184
185        sales_table.setItems(rows);
186    }
187
188    // Pop Up Notifications 
189    private void showAlert(String msg) {
190        Alert alert = new Alert(Alert.AlertType.INFORMATION);
191        alert.setHeaderText(null);
192        alert.setContentText(msg);
193        alert.showAndWait();
194    }
195}
